Description: Rim, neck and bifid handle sherd (mended from six fragments, with some plaster) of East Greek (Late Wild Goat?) pottery krater; pale brown clay with much silver mica; glaze mostly fired orange and much worn; exterior: evidence of cream slip and decoration; band of dots on outer edge of rim and handle; interior: cream slip; reserved or added white band on mid-neck; meander to right on rim; inscription cut in large letters over meander.
Curator's comments: From same pot as 1888,0601.708 b & c
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1176)
